paragraphs.zh-tw: 我叫做Emmanuel Jal我經歷過許多事長期以來，我向大眾述說那些痛苦的往事
paragraphs.en: I just want to say my name is Emmanuel Jal. And I come from a long way. I've been telling a story that has been so painful for me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 對我來說，這是個辛苦的過程，我拜訪各國演說將我的故事撰寫成書也像現在這樣演講
paragraphs.en: It's been a tough journey for me, traveling the world, telling my story in form of a book. And also telling it like now.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 還有，最輕鬆的方式是透過音樂來傳達我的想法我替自己取了個綽號，叫做戰地兒童
paragraphs.en: And also, the easiest one was when I was doing it in form of a music. So I have branded myself as a war child.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我這麼做是因為和我同個村莊的老婦人失去了她的孩子沒有新聞願意報導她的苦痛以及她想為社會做的改變
paragraphs.en: I'm doing this because of an old lady in my village now, who have lost her children. There is no newspaper to cover her pain, and what she wants to change in this society.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我這麼做，也是為了一個年輕人他想要改變，卻無處發聲因為他不會寫字也沒有網路，沒有Facebook、Myspace或是YouTube等平台讓他們發聲
paragraphs.en: And I'm doing it for a young man who want to create a change and has no way to project his voice because he can't write. Or there is no Internet, like Facebook, MySpace, YouTube, for them to talk.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 另一個無形鞭策我這麼努力地說故事四處分享這痛苦歷程的動力，就是我的夢想有時候就像是，我會聽到那些不幸喪命的人的聲音告訴我，「別放棄，堅持下去」因為我曾經幾度想放棄我不曉得這麼做會把自己推向什麼境地我出生時，正好是生活最艱困的時刻我的國家承受戰火摧殘
paragraphs.en: Also one thing that kept me pushing this story, this painful stories out, the dreams I have, sometimes, is like the voices of the dead, that I have seen would tell me, "Don't give up. Keep on going." Because sometime I feel like stopping and not doing it, because I didn't know what I was putting myself into. Well I was born in the most difficult time, when my country was at war.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我看著我的村莊被燒毀這個對我意義非凡的世界，從我眼前消失
paragraphs.en: I saw my village burned down. The world that meant a lot to me, I saw it vanish in my face.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我五歲時，看到我阿姨被強姦母親死於戰爭
paragraphs.en: I saw my aunt in rape when I was only five. My mother was claimed by the war.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的兄弟姐妹們四散各處到現在，即使我和我的父親已不在一起我對他還是心懷芥蒂
paragraphs.en: My brothers and sisters were scattered. And up to now, me and my father were detached and I still have issues with him.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我每天目睹死亡看著母親哭泣就像是被暴戾之氣扶養帶大一樣所以我自稱戰地兒童
paragraphs.en: Seeing people die every day, my mother crying, it's like I was raised in a violence. And that made me call myself a war child.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不只如此，在我八歲時我成了童兵我不知道打仗是為了什麼
paragraphs.en: And not only that, when I was eight I became a child soldier. I didn't know what was the war for.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我只知道那些在我腦中、揮之不去的畫面當我到了童兵訓練營，我說我想要儘可能殺光所有的回教徒和阿拉伯人裡面的訓練很辛苦，但那是我支撐下去的動力因為我想替家人復仇
paragraphs.en: But one thing I knew was an image that I saw that stuck in my head. When I went to the training camp I say, "I want to kill as many Muslims, and as many Arabs, as possible." The training wasn't easy, but that was the driving force, because I wanted to revenge for my family.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我想為村民復仇幸運地，現在一切有了轉機因為我發現了事實
paragraphs.en: I wanted to revenge for my village. Luckily now things have changed because I came to discover the truth.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 殺我們的並不是回教徒不是阿拉伯人而是某些藏在暗處、操縱我們的人他們利用我們的信仰，獲得他想要的也就是石油、鑽石黃金和土地
paragraphs.en: What was actually killing us wasn't the Muslims, wasn't the Arabs. It was somebody sitting somewhere manipulating the system, and using religion to get what they want to get out of us, which is the oil, the diamond, the gold and the land.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 理解到這個事實，讓我有能力選擇我該繼續憤怒，還是放下？而我選擇原諒。現在我和回教徒一起高歌、一塊跳舞我甚至還拍了一部由回教徒贊助的電影叫做「戰地兒童」
paragraphs.en: So realizing the truth gave me a position to choose: should I continue to hate, or let it go? So I happened to forgive. Now I sing music with the Muslims. I dance with them. I even had a movie out called "War Child," funded by Muslim people.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 痛苦已漸漸離去但我的故事是很龐雜的
paragraphs.en: So that pain has gone out. But my story is huge.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以現在，我要用一個不同的作法一個對我來說簡單一點的方式我想朗誦一首詩叫做「被迫犯罪」選自我的專輯《戰地兒童》它在說我的故事
paragraphs.en: So I'm just going to go into a different step now, which is easier for me. I'm going to give you poem called "Forced to Sin," which is from my album "War Child." I talk about my story.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在一次行軍因為沒有食物，我必須吃下同伴的屍體果腹一開始我們的隊伍有400人行軍最後，只剩下16人還活著
paragraphs.en: One of the journey that I tread when I was tempted to eat my friend because we had no food and we were like around 400. And only 16 people survived that journey.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我希望，你們能聽見我的聲音我在夢中反覆煎熬
paragraphs.en: So I hope you're going to hear this. My dreams are like torment.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 每一刻腦中都傳來死去朋友的聲音
paragraphs.en: My every moment. Voices in my brain, of friends that was slain.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 他們就像Lual這樣，再也無法承受飢餓死在我身旁在烈火焚林，也在廣漠荒原
paragraphs.en: Friends like Lual who died by my side, of starvation. In the burning jungle, and the desert plain.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 下一個應該就輪到我，但耶穌聽見了我的哭喊就當我要吃下同伴的腐爛身軀時祂給我慰藉
paragraphs.en: Next was I, but Jesus heard my cry. As I was tempted to eat the rotten flesh of my comrade, he gave me comfort.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們曾掠奪村莊偷走雞隻和羊群偷走所有能吃的東西我明白這很粗蠻，但我們需要食物
paragraphs.en: We used to raid villages, stealing chickens, goats and sheeps, anything we could eat. I knew it was rude, but we needed food.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我不得不犯罪為了生存，我被迫去犯罪為了生存，我被迫去犯罪有時候，你必須有失，才能有得
paragraphs.en: And therefore I was forced to sin, forced to sin to make a living, forced to sin to make a living. Sometimes you gotta lose to win.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 別放棄，別投降七歲離家
paragraphs.en: Never give up. Never give in. Left home at the age of seven.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 一年後，身邊多了把AK-47步槍睡覺還得睜著一隻眼
paragraphs.en: One year later, live with an AK-47 by my side. Slept with one eye open wide.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 奔跑、閃避、裝死、躲藏同伴們彷彿螻蟻般一個個死去
paragraphs.en: Run, duck, play dead and hide. I've seen my people die like flies.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但我從沒見過任何一具屍體至少沒見過因我而死的屍體但每當我徘徊，仍不認輸
paragraphs.en: But I've never seen a dead body, at least one that I've killed. But still as I wonder, I won't go under.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 四處都是槍林彈雨當時還年幼脆弱的我無法忘卻那個人說的話
paragraphs.en: Guns barking like lightning and thunder. As a child so young and tender, Words I can't forget I still remember.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我看見那個指揮官高舉雙手喊「不撤退，不投降」我遍體鱗傷
paragraphs.en: I saw sergeant command raising his hand, no retreat, no surrender. I carry the banner of the trauma.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 戰地兒童，沒有母親的孩子仍上演著拚鬥的冒險故事然而在這場嶄新的戰役中，我並不孤單
paragraphs.en: War child, child without a mama, still fighting in the saga. Yet as I wage this new war I'm not alone in this drama.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不到終點決不休息像個愛國的警察般全力以赴不分日夜地奮鬥
paragraphs.en: No sit or stop, as I reach for the top I'm fully dedicated like a patriotic cop. I'm on a fight, day and night.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有時犯錯，是為了成就對的事彷彿一直以來，我都活在夢中
paragraphs.en: Sometime I do wrong in order to make things right. It's like I'm living a dream.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 直到現在，才頭一次感覺自己像個人阿！達佛的孩子
paragraphs.en: First time I'm feeling like a human being. Ah! The children of Darfur.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 電視中你飢餓的肚皮正是我奮鬥的原因離開家園
paragraphs.en: Your empty bellies on the telly and now it's you that I'm fighting for. Left home.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不曉得何時才能回家我的家園被戰爭摧毀
paragraphs.en: Don't even know the day I'll ever return. My country is war-torn.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 陪伴我的音樂，是隆隆作響的炸彈和槍聲太多人死亡，我甚至再也流不出淚
paragraphs.en: Music I used to hear was bombs and fire of guns. So many people die that I don't even cry no more.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 請問蒼天，我的存在有意義嗎為什麼我們如此窮困
paragraphs.en: Ask God question, what am I here for. And why are my people poor.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 為什麼當其他孩子在上學時我卻學習如何打仗我吃過蝸牛、禿鷹、兔子、蛇任何有生命的東西
paragraphs.en: And why, why when the rest of the children were learning how to read and write, I was learning how to fight. I ate snails, vultures, rabbits, snakes, and anything that had life.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我都吃過我知道很丟臉，但我能怪誰？這就是我的故事(鼓掌)
paragraphs.en: I was ready to eat. I know it's a shame. But who is to be blamed? That's my story shared in the form of a lesson.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 謝謝(鼓掌)我的音樂是支持我繼續的力量
paragraphs.en: Thank you. What energized me and kept me going is the music I do.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 沒人能替我向大眾訴說我的故事找人來輔導我、安慰我所以音樂成了我療傷的藥方
paragraphs.en: I never saw anybody to tell my story to them so they could advise me or do therapy. So the music had been my therapy for me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在音樂裡，我看見天堂在那裡，我能感受快樂我能找回童真，自在跳舞我知道世上只有音樂能有力量穿越你的肌膚你的意志、你的心靈影響你的靈魂並且在不知不覺中影響你的生活方式
paragraphs.en: It's been where I actually see heaven, where I can be happy, where I can be a child again, in dances, through music. So one thing I know about music: music is the only thing that has power to enter your cell system, your mind, your heart, influence your soul and your spirit, and can even influence the way you live without even you knowing.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 只有音樂，才能讓你早上自然地從床上醒來不假思索地踢踢雙腳我常拿音樂的力量和愛的力量相提並論愛是不分種族膚色的
paragraphs.en: Music is the only thing that can make you want to wake up your bed and shake your leg, without even wanting to do it. And so the power music has I normally compare to the power love when love doesn't see a color.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 就像你愛上了青蛙，也就只能愛上了關於我發現音樂強大力量的另一則故事是發生在我還是童兵的時候
paragraphs.en: You know, if you fall in love with a frog, that's it. One testimony about how I find music is powerful is when I was still a soldier back then.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 當時我痛恨北方的人但我就是不恨他們的音樂
paragraphs.en: I hated the people in the north. But I don't know why I don't hate their music.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們總能隨他們的音樂起舞狂歡最讓我吃驚的是有天，一個阿拉伯音樂家來營裡為士兵們表演
paragraphs.en: So we party and dance to their music. And one thing that shocked me is one day they brought an Arab musician to come and entertain the soldiers.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那次我跳舞跳到腳都快斷了所以我有了個疑問
paragraphs.en: And I almost broke my leg dancing to his music. But I had this question.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我現在成了音樂人，也懂得了音樂的力量從以前的我到現在，這中間發生了什麼事？最近我正在進行一項痛苦的修煉
paragraphs.en: So now I'm doing music so I know what the power of music is. So what's happening here? I've been in a painful journey.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這段時間我只吃晚餐到今天是第233天沒有早餐、沒有午餐
paragraphs.en: Today is day number 233 in which I only eat dinner. I don't eat breakfast. No lunch.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我發起一個運動叫做「先有失，才有得」像我現在做的事我放棄了一些東西來贏得勝利
paragraphs.en: And I've done a campaign called Lose to Win. Where I'm losing so that I could win the battle that I'm fighting now.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的早餐、午餐都捐給我成立的慈善機構因為我想為蘇丹的孩子蓋間學校另一方面，我這麼做也是因為在我的國家，一天吃一餐是很正常的
paragraphs.en: So my breakfast, my lunch, I donate it to a charity that I founded because we want to build a school in Sudan. And I'm doing this because also it's a normal thing in my home, people eat one meal a day.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 現在我到了西方國家，我仍選擇只吃一餐在我家鄉的孩子們會聽著BBC或其他廣播等著想知道何時Emmanuel會重新開始吃早餐因為，那就表示有錢蓋學校了
paragraphs.en: Here I am in the West. I choose not to. So in my village now, kids there, they normally listen to BBC, or any radio, and they are waiting to know, the day Emmanuel will eat his breakfast it means he got the money to build our school.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我做了承諾，我說「我決定不要吃早餐」我以為依照我的名氣，一個月內應該就能達成目標後來發現是我想太多了所以我花了232天
paragraphs.en: And so I made a commitment. I say, "I'm gonna not eat my breakfast." I thought I was famous enough that I would raise the money within one month, but I've been humbled. So it's taken me 232 days.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而我還是說，「未達目的決不放棄」在Facebook和Myspace都有人響應我的行動有人捐出三塊美金
paragraphs.en: And I said, "No stop until we get it." And like it's been done on Facebook, MySpace. The people are giving three dollars.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們也曾獲得最低的捐贈，美金20分對方透過網路捐了美金20分
paragraphs.en: The lowest amount we ever got was 20 cents. Somebody donated 20 cents online.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我真不曉得他們怎麼做到的但他們的善心感動了我
paragraphs.en: I don't know how they did it. But that moved me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 對我而言，教育是值得用生命換取的我願意誓死奉獻因為我知道這能為我的族人做什麼
paragraphs.en: And so, the importance of education to me is what I'm willing to die for. I'm willing to die for this, because I know what it can do to my people.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 教育啟發心智賦予我們選擇的權利讓我們有生存的機會那是個羸弱不堪的國度
paragraphs.en: Education enlighten your brain, give you so many chances, and you're able to survive. As a nation we have been crippled.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 多年來只能靠援助維生你可以看到2、30歲的人與家人同住在難民營
paragraphs.en: For so many years we have fed on aid. You see a 20-years-old, 30-years-old families in a refugee camps.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 他們只能得到聯合國空投下來的食物這些人如果只給予他們救濟物資的話，就形同扼殺了整個世代
paragraphs.en: They only get the food that drops from the sky, from the U.N. So these people, you're killing a whole generation if you just give them aid.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 如果有任何人想幫助我們請先了解我們的需要請給我們工具，給我們農具
paragraphs.en: If anybody want to help us this is what we need. Give us tools. Give the farmers tools.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 非洲有雨水、有沃土，人們是可以耕作的請投資教育吧
paragraphs.en: It's rain. Africa is fertile. They can grow the crops. Invest in education.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 投資教育，我們才能有健全的組織足以發起革新，改變原有的一切那些在非洲製造戰爭的老頭們垂垂老矣，很快就會死了
paragraphs.en: Education so that we have strong institution that can create a revolution to change everything. Because we have all those old men that are creating wars in Africa. They will die soon.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 如果你們投資教育我們就能改造非洲這就是我所呼籲的
paragraphs.en: But if you invest in education then we'll be able to change Africa. That's what I'm asking.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 為了這個目標我創立了Gua Africa機構安置孩子上學而現在幾個孩子已上了大學
paragraphs.en: So in order to do that, I founded a charter called Gua Africa, where we put kids in school. And now we have a couple in university.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們有40幾個孩子，他們有些曾是童兵還有一些我們認為同樣需要支援的孩子我說，我們要付諸實踐和那些願意跟隨我、幫助我的人
paragraphs.en: We have like 40 kids, ex-child soldiers mixed with anybody that we feel like we want to support. And I said "I'm going to put it in practice." And with the people that are going to follow me and help me do things.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們想要做出改變創造不同的世界現在，時間不多了我想唱首歌
paragraphs.en: That's what I want to do to change, to make a difference in the world. Well now, my time is going, so I want to sing a song.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 請大家站起來讓我們來讚頌一位英國的救助人員她叫做Emma McCune因為她，我才能站在這我要唱這首歌邀你們一同感受這位女子如何發揮影響
paragraphs.en: But I'll ask you guys to stand up so we celebrate the life of a British aid worker called Emma McCune that made it possible for me to be here. I'm gonna sing this song, just to inspire you how this woman has made a difference.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 她來到我的國家看見教育的重要性她說幫助蘇丹唯一的方法就是投資在教育女人教育小孩上他們才有辦法在這複雜的環境中做出改變
paragraphs.en: She came to my country and saw the importance of education. She said the only way to help Sudan is to invest in the women, educating them, educating the children, so that they could come and create a revolution in this complex society.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 她甚至後來選擇嫁給蘇丹人民解放軍的指揮官她拯救了超過150個童兵
paragraphs.en: So she even ended up marrying a commander from the SPLA. And she rescued over 150 child soldiers.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 其中一個就是我所以現在我想邀請大家跟我一起讚頌Emma
paragraphs.en: One of them happened to be me now. And so at this moment I want to ask to celebrate Emma with me.
